alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 9:05PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Brown, Calumet, eastern Winnebago, Outagamie, eastern Shawano and western Manitowoc Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 905 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Navarino Wildlife Area to Menasha to North Fond Du Lac. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kimberly and Darboy around 910 PM CDT. Kaukauna, Little Chute and High Cliff State Park around 915 PM CDT. Pulaski and Central Lake Winnebago around 920 PM CDT. Green Bay and Brillion around 930 PM CDT. St Anna around 935 PM CDT. Bay Shore Park, Denmark and Camp Rokilio Scout Camp around 945 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Wayside, Rose Lawn, Freedom, Howard, Allenville, St John, Shirley, Potter, Eaa and Uw Fox Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Winnebago
